commonMistakes.mistake: Not providing href attributes for navigation items
commonMistakes.why: Prevents active state highlighting and breaks proper navigation semantics
commonMistakes.instead: Always provide href for navigation items, omit only for non-navigational headings

commonMistakes.mistake: Creating too many nested levels beyond groups and items
commonMistakes.why: Creates confusing navigation hierarchy and poor user experience
commonMistakes.instead: Limit to two levels: groups containing items. Use separate menus for deeper hierarchies
commonMistakes.example:
// ❌ Wrong - too many levels
<GoabSideMenuGroup heading="Admin">
  <GoabSideMenuGroup heading="Users">
    <GoabSideMenuGroup heading="Permissions">
      <GoabSideMenuHeading>View Users</GoabSideMenuHeading>
    </GoabSideMenuGroup>
  </GoabSideMenuGroup>
</GoabSideMenuGroup>

// ✅ Correct - two levels maximum
<GoabSideMenuGroup heading="User Management">
  <GoabSideMenuHeading href="/admin/users">All Users</GoabSideMenuHeading>
  <GoabSideMenuHeading href="/admin/permissions">Permissions</GoabSideMenuHeading>
</GoabSideMenuGroup>

commonMistakes.mistake: Using side menu for primary navigation instead of secondary
commonMistakes.why: Side menus are for organizing content within a section, not site-wide navigation
commonMistakes.instead: Use main navigation for primary site sections, side menu for page-level organization
commonMistakes.example:
// ❌ Wrong - primary navigation
<GoabSideMenu>
  <GoabSideMenuHeading href="/">Home</GoabSideMenuHeading>
  <GoabSideMenuHeading href="/about">About</GoabSideMenuHeading>
  <GoabSideMenuHeading href="/contact">Contact</GoabSideMenuHeading>
</GoabSideMenu>

// ✅ Correct - secondary navigation
<GoabSideMenu>
  <GoabSideMenuGroup heading="Dashboard">
    <GoabSideMenuHeading href="/admin/overview">Overview</GoabSideMenuHeading>
    <GoabSideMenuHeading href="/admin/analytics">Analytics</GoabSideMenuHeading>
  </GoabSideMenuGroup>
</GoabSideMenu>

commonMistakes.mistake: Not considering mobile responsive behavior during implementation
commonMistakes.why: Side menus don't work well on small screens without responsive planning
commonMistakes.instead: Plan for mobile navigation patterns like collapsible sidebar or header integration

commonMistakes.mistake: Inconsistent grouping logic that confuses users
commonMistakes.why: Poor information architecture makes navigation difficult to understand
commonMistakes.instead: Group related functionality logically with clear, descriptive group names
commonMistakes.example:
// ❌ Wrong - unclear grouping
<GoabSideMenuGroup heading="Stuff">
  <GoabSideMenuHeading href="/users">Users</GoabSideMenuHeading>
  <GoabSideMenuHeading href="/reports">Reports</GoabSideMenuHeading>
  <GoabSideMenuHeading href="/settings">Settings</GoabSideMenuHeading>
</GoabSideMenuGroup>

// ✅ Correct - logical grouping
<GoabSideMenuGroup heading="User Management">
  <GoabSideMenuHeading href="/users">All Users</GoabSideMenuHeading>
  <GoabSideMenuHeading href="/users/roles">Roles & Permissions</GoabSideMenuHeading>
</GoabSideMenuGroup>
<GoabSideMenuGroup heading="Reports">
  <GoabSideMenuHeading href="/reports/activity">Activity Reports</GoabSideMenuHeading>
</GoabSideMenuGroup>

frameworkNotes.propCasing: React uses camelCase (testId), web components use lowercase (testid), Angular uses camelCase in templates. Multi-word props like side-menu-group become sideMenuGroup in React
frameworkNotes.slotHandling: React and Angular use children/content projection for nested structure. Web components use slot content. Structure is GoabSideMenu > GoabSideMenuGroup > GoabSideMenuHeading
frameworkNotes.constraints: Groups require heading prop. Items should have href for navigation. Maximum two-level hierarchy recommended. Icons are optional and use string names
frameworkNotes.responsiveBehavior: No automatic responsive behavior - component maintains fixed layout. Developers must implement mobile navigation patterns (drawer, collapse, etc.)

derivedFrom.note: See maintainer version for implementation details and development information

function DocumentationNav({ currentSection }) {
  const [openSections, setOpenSections] = useState(new Set(['getting-started']));
  
  // Auto-expand section based on current page
  useEffect(() => {
    if (currentSection) {

export class AdminNavComponent implements OnInit {
  currentRoute = '';

}

  user: User | null = null;
  isHRUser = false;
  isITUser = false;

  constructor(private userService: UserService) {}

  ngOnInit() {
    this.userService.getCurrentUser().subscribe(user => {
      this.user = user;
      this.isHRUser = user?.department === 'Human Resources';
      this.isITUser = user?.department === 'Information Technology';
    });
  }
}
